content.description: Route starts on large handle bar feature. Goes up and left from here. Runout to anchors. Don't let the safety rating deter you from trying this if you're confident at this grade. The climb is a great mental trainer for runout climbing.
Start on two rounded holds. Pulling the lip is the crux. Fun route.

This route zig-zags. Zig left from the inside corner, clip first bolt, go up to second bolt, zag right and then up. (Going straight up to first bolt provides a slightly harder start). Gets full sun exposure by mid- to late-morning. 

  Location is about 30 left of Power Squat.
content.protection: 2 lead bolts; two chains for anchor.

content.description: Starts in golden overhung area right of "Waste of Bolts." First bolt is rather high, consider stick clipping. Crux is moving past this bolt. Crimp slab climbing after to anchors.
Crux is getting on the route.  Shortest route on the Hand Beyond Wall and most likely all of Reimer's.
content.location: This route is located 10" to the right of Camp Fire Jesus and 10' left of a small chossy cave.

content.description: Use pockets low down, less positive holds higher up. Routes on this wall are not climbed much, so holds are rough.
Starts right of arete.
Starts left of arete.
Shares start with Jugular, but then you angle left towards first bolt. It's a short 2 clip climb that remains in the tan shallow bowl to the overhang.
content.location: Between Ezra's Shelf and Go For the Jugular.  In front of a boulder bench. The line goes straight up on the tan color rock, left of the flake system.

content.description: Shares anchors with Deception Pass, but its the line directly under the roof...pulling roof is crux on nasty sharp 2/3 finger pocket. Tape up.
content.location: Biggest mini roof on wall, very far right side of wall and shares same anchors as Deception Pass.

content.description: Start with fun moves up a huge flake/crack.  The one-move crux comes about halfway up, making a long-ish move off a left-hand sidepull to the titular "jugular" hold.  Very fun.
content.protection: Two or three bolts plus anchors.

content.description: good holds on a slightly negative face. Great warm up for the area.

Start on ground below chest-high overhang and right of first bolt. Crux is getting off the ground and feet onto the face (scrunch into a frog and ribbet). Several more hard moves on the face, clip second bolt and climb much easier moves to anchor. Some say 11a. 

  5.8 'Antonian' variation: start on boulder left of first bolt. Runout - be confident at the grade.
content.location: Just left of 'Waste of Bolts', this route goes up the face just left of the 'arete'.

content.description:
Two arguably different routes share the same bolt line: 

  Left Fry - 5.10b: Stay left of bolt line on crimps, pull the mini bulge near the top for the crux. 

  Right Fry - 5.10a: Stay right of bolt line on crimps and jugs
Taller climbers can reach up and clip the first bolt while standing on the boulder. Medium- and large-sized holds up the slightly overhanging face.  Difficulty seems consistent all the way up.
content.location: 15 feet right of Freedom Fries, starting from a boulder 4 feet high, 3 feet left of a tree.

content.description: Climb the short face to the first bolt and then head up to the right side of the roof.  Pull through the roof using a series of small, off balance side pulls on equally small foot holds (crux).  The trick is to continuously get your feet as high as possible, transfer your weight to the high foot, and then pull up a little more.  Clip the second bolt just above the roof (felt very off balance here) and then continue up the dihedral past one more bolt to the anchors.  The climbing eases significantly above the second bolt.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor shared with Overlord (5.12b).
content.location: Deception Pass is the first climb on Hand Beyond Wall (side closest to Dead Cats).  Look for a roof about a third of the way up with a dihedral above.

content.description: Climb a pocketed face about five feet to the right of a tree.  The initial moves are a little tough, but the climbing eases past the first bolt.  Continue past two more bolts on solid holds to the anchors.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Daddys Girl is located on the center part of the wall, about five feet to the right of a large tree.  This route is located to the left of Freedom Fries and to the right of Booger Boy.

content.description: Small holds down low, larger rough holds higher up. Northern-most route at Reimers North Band.
content.location: Left-most route on wall, starting directly off the trail.

content.description: Start just left side of large oak tree.  Start is crux to first bolt.
Same bolts as Hidden Agenda (5.11b) but climb to left of the bolts. Stay off the flake system, if you use flake than you are starting on Annie Up (5.7. Crux is right below anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolts and anchors. I gave it a PG-13 for those purists who dont stick clip, pre clip. If you dont get the first clip, the landing zone is awful with small stack boulder below you. Could possibly break ankles due to awkward fall. However, if you just pre-clip on the stacked boulders. Also, its runout between bolt 1 and 2, so make sure you can lead 5.8 solidly or else its a decker for sure on those stacked boulders below.
content.location: To the left of the rounded right leaning arete and to the right of the flake system.

content.description: Climb the gray streak to the right of Annie Up. STAY OFF THE FLAKE SYSTEM the entire time to keep it a 5.9. Gold holds all the way up.
content.protection: Same bolts as Annie Up. 2 bolts and anchors.
content.location: Same start as Annie UP, but go up gray streak.

content.description: Short, easy climb with harder variations possible.  The bottom half is easy and straight forward with large pockets and solid moves.  Above the second bolt, climb the flake up and left, and then step right to the anchors to keep the climb at 5.6.  A 5.9-ish variation climbs straight to the anchors from the second bolt.  The climbing is much thinner, and there are good holds around the anchors, but they are a little reachy.
content.protection: Two bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the right side of Hand Beyond Wall, look for the left trending flake that leads to the top of the cliff band about five routes to the left of Deception Pass.

content.description: Hand Beyond Wall is the last climbing area on the Dead Cats side of Reimer's Ranch.  Once you pass the T-Roofic Wall and Tit For Tom areas, the wall becomes progressively shorter until it disappears all together.  All of the routes are short -- typically three bolts on the side closer to Tit For Tom and two bolts farther to the left.  Almost all of the climbs are in the 5.9 to 5.11 range.  Typically not as crowded as other areas at Reimers.
